description: Sum of distinct orders of degree-n permutations.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: G.f.: Prod(p prime, 1 + Sum(k >= 1, p^k*x^(p^k))) / (1-x). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 18 2002
example: Set of orders of all degree 7 permutations is {1,2,3,4,5,6,7,10,12) so a(7)=1+2+3+4+5+6+7+10+12=50.
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 19 2001
extensions: a(0)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 01 2015
